questions.question: A Mass-Spring-Damper system having force as input and displacement of the mass as output having transfer function: G(s) = 1/( s<sup>2</sup> +24s +900 )  . A force input F (t) =10 sin (70t) is applied at time t=0 s. A beam from an optical stroboscope is focused on the mass .In steady-state the strobe frequency in hertz at which the mass appears to be stationary is,
The equation of free vibration of a system is   d<sup>2</sup>x/dt<sup>2</sup> +64π<sup>2</sup>x = 0, its natural frequency would be,
The equation of motion of a spring mass damper system is    d<sup>2</sup>x)/dt<sup>2</sup> + 3 dx/dt + 9kx = 10 sin⁡(5t). The damping factor for the system is,

A vehicle suspension system consists of a spring and damper. The stiffness of the spring is 3.6 kN/m and the damping constant of the damper is 400 Ns/m. If the mass value is 50 kg, then the value of damping factor ζ and damped natural frequency (f<sub>d</sub>) are,
In an oscillating mass-spring system, the velocity of the mass is greatest when the mass is,

answers.b: at the point of maximum displacement
answers.c: at the point where acceleration is greatest.
answers.d: halfway between the equilibrium point and maximum displacement

questions.question: An object attached to an ideal spring executes simple harmonic motion. If you want to double its total energy, you could

answers.a: double the force constant (spring constant) of the spring
answers.c: double both the amplitude and force constant (spring constant).
